class=\"table-wrap-foot\"><span id=\"fn-TFN004\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN004\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> All quantities are corrected for lensing magnification. SFR is calculated from the H\u03b1 or H\u03b2 luminosity corrected for dust extinction based on <em>A</em><sub><em>V</em></sub>. The half-light radius <em>r</em><sub>1</sub>/2 is based on the H\u03b1 or H\u03b2 morphology as described in the text. <em>A</em><sub><em>v</em></sub> and <em>M</em><sub>*</sub> are estimated from SED fitting of broad-band photometry as described in the text, except for those marked (<em>a</em>), which are from Richard et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib79\"></span>2011). Targets below the line are from Jones et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib44\"></span>2010a), with SFRs given in their table 2 and half-light radii reported by Richard et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib79\"></span>2011).</p></span></div></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;          \"><a class=\"fig-view-orig openInAnotherWindow btn class=\"table-wrap-foot\"><span id=\"fn-TFN004\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN004\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> All quantities are corrected for lensing magnification. SFR is calculated from the H\u03b1 or H\u03b2 luminosity corrected for dust extinction based on <em>A</em><sub><em>V</em></sub>. The half-light radius <em>r</em><sub>1</sub>/2 is based on the H\u03b1 or H\u03b2 morphology as described in the text. <em>A</em><sub><em>v</em></sub> and <em>M</em><sub>*</sub> are estimated from SED fitting of broad-band photometry as described in the text, except for those marked (<em>a</em>), which are from Richard et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib79\"></span>2011). Targets below the line are from Jones et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib44\"></span>2010a), with SFRs given in their table 2 and half-light radii reported by Richard et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib79\"></span>2011).</p></span></div></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;          \"><a class=\"fig-view-orig openInAnotherWindow btn class=\"table-wrap-foot\"><span id=\"fn-TFN003\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN003\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> Inclination and PA are derived from the best-fitting disc models. <em>v</em><sub>2.2</sub> is the velocity at 2.2<em>r</em><sub>1/2</sub>, where <em>r</em><sub>1/2</sub> is the half-light radius. Velocity dispersion, \u03c3, is the luminosity-weighted mean local value, after deconvolving for local velocity gradient. The velocity gradient <em>v</em>/<em>r</em> is measured at <em>r</em><sub>1/2</sub>. Targets below the line are from Jones et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib44\"></span>2010a) with values reported in their table 2, except for <em>v</em><sub>2.2</sub>, <em>v</em>/<em>r</em> and <em>v</em>/\u03c3, which we measure for consistency with the new data. No values for \u03b8, PA or <em>v</em><sub>2.2</sub> are given for Cl0949-arc1 as this galaxy cannot be fit by a disc model.</p></span></div></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;          \"><a class=\"fig-view-orig openInAnotherWindow btn js-view-large\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"/view-large/[XSLTSectionID][QueryString]\">\r\n          Open in new tab\r\n class=\"table-wrap-foot\"><span id=\"fn-TFN003\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN003\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> Inclination and PA are derived from the best-fitting disc models. <em>v</em><sub>2.2</sub> is the velocity at 2.2<em>r</em><sub>1/2</sub>, where <em>r</em><sub>1/2</sub> is the half-light radius. Velocity dispersion, \u03c3, is the luminosity-weighted mean local value, after deconvolving for local velocity gradient. The velocity gradient <em>v</em>/<em>r</em> is measured at <em>r</em><sub>1/2</sub>. Targets below the line are from Jones et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib44\"></span>2010a) with values reported in their table 2, except for <em>v</em><sub>2.2</sub>, <em>v</em>/<em>r</em> and <em>v</em>/\u03c3, which we measure for consistency with the new data. No values for \u03b8, PA or <em>v</em><sub>2.2</sub> are given for Cl0949-arc1 as this galaxy cannot be fit by a disc model.</p></span></div></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;          \"><a class=\"fig-view-orig openInAnotherWindow btn js-view-large\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"/view-large/[XSLTSectionID][QueryString]\">\r\n          Open in new tab\r\n        </a></div></div></div>          $(this).removeClass('hide');\r\n                            }\r\n                        });\r\n                    }\r\n                });\r\n\r\n event.slot.getSlotElementId()).each(function () {\r\n                            var $adblockDiv = $(this).find('.js-adblock');\r\n                            var $adText = $(this).find('.js-adblock-advertisement-text');\r\n                            if ($adblockDiv && $adblockDiv.is(':visible') && $adblockDiv.find('*').length > 1) {\r\n (b) \u03bc<sub>lin</sub> gives the linear magnification factors in the direction of greatest magnification and perpendicular to that axis. (b) \u03bc<sub>lin</sub> gives the linear magnification factors in the direction of greatest magnification and perpendicular to that axis. class=\"table-wrap-foot\"><span id=\"fn-TFN001\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN001\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> (a) To identify the arcs, we use the cluster names and the arc ID from the published lens model or the system number where we observe multiple images of the same galaxy, except for the Cosmic Eye which is also known as LBG J213512.73-010143. MACS clusters are truncations of MACSJ0744.8+3927, MACSJ1149.5+2223, MACSJ0451.9+0006, MACSJ0712.3+5931 and MACSJ2135.2'0102 (Ebeling, Edge &amp; Henry <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib20\"></span>2001; Ebeling et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib21\"></span>2007, <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib22\"></span>2010; Mann &amp; Ebeling <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib65\"></span>2012). class=\"table-wrap-foot\"><span id=\"fn-TFN001\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN001\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> (a) To identify the arcs, we use the cluster names and the arc ID from the published lens model or the system number where we observe multiple images of the same galaxy, except for the Cosmic Eye which is also known as LBG J213512.73-010143. MACS clusters are truncations of MACSJ0744.8+3927, MACSJ1149.5+2223, MACSJ0451.9+0006, MACSJ0712.3+5931 and MACSJ2135.2'0102 (Ebeling, Edge &amp; Henry <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib20\"></span>2001; Ebeling et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib21\"></span>2007, <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib22\"></span>2010; Mann &amp; Ebeling <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib65\"></span>2012). (b) Positions and redshifts are given for the target lensed arcs.</p></span></div></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;          \"><a class=\"fig-view-orig openInAnotherWindow btn id=\"fn-TFN005\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN005\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> All quantities are corrected for lensing where appropriate. (a): the clump radius is calculated as described in the text, using the area enclosed by an isophote and assuming circular symmetry. The error bar encompasses an alternative definition using the FWHM of the clump emission line profile. (b): SFR is calculated from the total H\u03b1 or H\u03b2 flux enclosed in the isophote and is corrected for extinction. (c): the velocity dispersion, \u03c3, is the mean local value within the clump and is deconvolved for the local velocity gradient.</p></span></div></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA; id=\"fn-TFN005\"></span><div content-id=\"TFN005\" class=\"footnote\"><span class=\"fn\"><p class=\"chapter-para\"><em>Notes.</em> All quantities are corrected for lensing where appropriate. (a): the clump radius is calculated as described in the text, using the area enclosed by an isophote and assuming circular symmetry. The error bar encompasses an alternative definition using the FWHM of the clump emission line profile. (b): SFR is calculated from the total H\u03b1 or H\u03b2 flux enclosed in the isophote and is corrected for extinction. (c): the velocity dispersion, \u03c3, is the mean local value within the clump and is deconvolved for the local velocity gradient.</p></span></div></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;
